subject: Re: [junit] Recording performance of classes, is it possible in JUnit ?
msgSnippet: ... JUnit can calculate the time it spent to process a test, but _not_ the time the class needs to process its own code.  The difference may be not that huge
messageBody:
> I wonder whether in JUnit has the feature to record
> the performance of my classes ?

JUnit can calculate the time it spent to process a test, but _not_ the
time the class needs to process its own code. The difference may be not
that huge but it's a point you have to consider.

If you connect to a database in the setUp() method and you have 20 tests
in that class, JUnit will connect 20 times to the database (everybody
knows that connecting to a database is not the quickiest thing on
earth).

If you have strong requirement, JUnit is not the tool (IMO) to use to
precisely measure performances.

You have to look at stress tools, not test tools.

-Vladimir

PS: but JUnit is great for tests ! :-)
